lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* @param filePath File path to receive input from and write to.
* @throws FileNotFoundException If file is not found.
* Executes the program after reading input from file or user.
* Marks tasks as done, and prints out relevant messages.
* @param input The user input to be processed.
* @throws DukeException If task index to be marked is not valid.
public void marking(String input) throws DukeException {
* Checks if input is a done command.
* @return Whether input is a done command.
* Checks if input is a valid todo command.
* @return Whether input is a valid todo command.
* Checks if input is a valid deadline command.
* @return Whether input is a valid deadline command.
* Checks if input is a valid event command.
* @return Whether input is a valid event command.
* Checks if input is a delete command.
* @return Whether input is a delete command.
* Returns the deadline associated with the deadline task.
* Returns the event date and time associated with the event task.
* @return The event date and time of the task.
* Returns the index of the task to be deleted.
* Checks whether a done command has a valid index.
* Parses the event/deadline time of an input.
* @return A LocalDateTime object holding the time information.
DateTimeFormatter dtf = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy HH:mm");
public void save(StorageList storageList) throws IOException {
private final ArrayList<Task> storageList = new ArrayList<>();
* Adds a task to the storage list/task list.
* Returns the task at the specified index.
* Returns the size of the storage list.
* Deletes a task from the specified index in the list.
* @param idx The index of the task to be deleted.
System.out.println("    Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
System.out.println("    Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Prints a message to confirm that Duke has read the given file.
System.out.println("I have received your file! Added tasks!\n");
* Prints a message to warn users that Duke cannot find the given file.
System.out.println("I am unable to find your file. "
* Prints a message to warn users of an unknown error.
* Prints a message to confirm that a task has been added to the list.
* @param desc The description of the task.
* @param size The size of the list.
public void taskAddedMsg(String desc, int size) {
System.out.println("    Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("    Now you have " + size + " tasks in the list.");
* Prints a message to confirm that a task has been deleted from the list.
* @param desc The description of the task.
* @param size The size of the list.
public void taskDeleteMsg(String desc, int size) {
System.out.println("    Noted. I've removed this task:");
System.out.println("    Now you have " + size + " tasks in the list.");
* Prints a message to confirm that a task has been marked as done.
System.out.println("    Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Prints various error messages for various error events.
* @return The error message relevant to the problem.
return "    OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.";
return "    OOPS!!! The description of a deadline cannot be empty.";
return "    OOPS!!! The description of an event cannot be empty.";
return "    OOPS!!! index out of bounds";
return "    OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(";
* Prints out all the tasks in the list.
* @param storageList The list storing all the tasks.
System.out.println("    Here are the tasks in your list:");
private DateTimeFormatter dateTimeFormatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy HH:mm");

* Returns the formatted string representation of the task.

* Returns the event's date and time
* Returns the formatted string representation of the task.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Returns the formatted string representation of the task.
